title: Ticket #5303: condor_userprio prints success even upon failure
description:
From a submit node one can run, eg. 

  condor_userprio -setfactor matthew.brinson@nemo.phys.uwm.edu 10.00

as a regular user and it will print 

  The priority factor of matthew.brinson@nemo.phys.uwm.edu was set to 10.000000

and return 0 even if it failed. The node is not listed in ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR as reported by condor_config_val.

Tom
remarks:
2015-Oct-19 17:17:15 by tannenba:
Yes, in versions of HTCondor previous to the code introduced in v8.3.6 with #4751, various tools (condor_userprio, condor_on, condor_reconfig, condor_off, ...) could not detect a failure due to authorization. The changed for the better as a result of #4751, thus I am resolving this ticket.

So doing the above with HTCondor v8.4.x+ I get the following: 

[tannenba@submit-3 ~]$ condor_userprio -setprio tannenba@chtc.wisc.edu 5
failed to send SET_PRIORITY command to negotiator
[tannenba@submit-3 ~]$ echo $?
1
creator: tpdownes
